title: Sri Lanka schedules 5 hours of power cuts for Apr 04
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Power cuts of up to 5 hours have been approve in Sri Lanka for April 04 Monday Public Utilities Commission Chairman Janaka Ratnayake aid as severe foreign exchange shortages to import fuel was temporarily eased with fuel on borrowed money from India.
Ratnayake said the Ceylon Electricity Board had requested 7 hours of power cuts but the regulator had allowed only 5 hours.
They will be spread over two slots. There will be 3 to 4 hour cuts in the daytime and 1 to 2 hours in the evening up to 10 hours.
Sri Lanka’s electricity demand had risen amid power cuts with more people using electricity for cooking and a delay in raising prices. (Colombo/April 1/2022)
